                    ### Question
                    Which of the following drugs is used to treat both diabetes mellitus and diabetes insipidus

                    ### Options
                    opa. Chlorpropamide
opb. Glibenclamide
opc. Glicazide
opd. Glipizide

### Enhanced Information (For Contextual Support):
Chlorpropamide is an oral hypoglycemic agent that stimulates insulin release and lowers blood glucose levels. Importantly, it also has antidiuretic effects, making it effective in treating diabetes insipidus. In contrast, Glibenclamide, Glicazide, and Glipizide are all sulfonylureas that primarily stimulate insulin secretion to lower blood glucose but do not have any known effects on diabetes insipidus. Therefore, among the options provided, only Chlorpropamide is used to treat both diabetes mellitus and diabetes insipidus.
